question: Approximately how much time passes between one full moon and the next?

content.source_1: Some introductory teaching materials round the Moon’s phase cycle to four weeks for simplicity.
content.source_3: Successive full moons are separated by one complete lunar phase cycle.
content.source_4: In astronomy, the time from one full moon to the next (the synodic month) averages about 29.53 days.
content.source_5: The interval between consecutive full moons equals one synodic month.
content.source_6: In everyday scheduling, people often approximate “a month” as four weeks, even though most calendar months are 30 or 31 days.
